page.title: 07Beverstone Church:Windows.
page.content: The windows of Beverstone Church are of interest in that they clearly demonstrate each of the main styles of architecture current during the middle ages.On the northern side of the chancel is a narrow Norman window with a round-headed arch,and next to it an Early-English lancet window with a pointed arch.The remaining windows,in the nave and Berkeley Chapel date fom the fourteenth century and are in the Decorated style.The glass is mostly recent and of little historical interest.
